action.action-desc: Mr. Figures (for himself and Mr. Edwards) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To amend the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act to provide requirements relating to the funding of predisaster hazard mitigation, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Building Resilient Infrastructure and Communities for All Act of 2025.

subsection.text: Section 203 of the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act (42 U.S.C. 5133) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (c) by striking or local government in each place it appears;

clause.text: in subparagraph (A) by striking not fewer than five local governments to receive assistance under this section and inserting projects to receive assistance under this section that are cost-effective and designed to reduce injuries, loss of life, and damage and destruction of property, including damage to critical services and facilities; and

in subparagraph (A) by striking in providing assistance to local governments under this section, the President shall select from local governments recommended by the Governors under this subsection. and inserting a State that receives funds under this section may use such funds only for projects recommended under paragraph (1)(A); and
by striking subparagraph (B) and inserting the following:

subparagraph.text: The President may approve a project that has not been recommended by a Governor under this subsection as an eligible use of funds if the President determines that extraordinary circumstances justify the selection and that making the selection will further the purpose of this section.

in paragraph (3) by striking the President may select, subject to the criteria specified in subsection (g), any local governments of the State to receive assistance under this section. and inserting such State may not receive funds under the formula described in subsection (f)(2).;

clause.text: by striking on a competitive basis and inserting to a State or an Indian tribal government through a direct allocation based on the formula described in paragraph (2); and
by striking and in accordance with the criteria in subsection (g);

subparagraph.text: by striking paragraph (2) and inserting the following:

paragraph.text: In providing financial assistance under this section, the President shall distribute to each eligible State available funds for a fiscal year using the following formula:

subparagraph.text: Thirty-three percent of available funds shall be distributed equally among each eligible State.

Thirty-three percent of available funds shall be distributed among each eligible State in a proportion that gives preference to such States that have a higher population, using data from the most recent census of the United States.

Thirty-three percent of available funds shall be distributed among each eligible State in a proportion that gives preference to States that have the most vulnerability to natural hazards in the critical infrastructure of such States.
in paragraph (3)(B) by striking on a competitive basis pursuant to paragraph (1) and inserting under this section; and
by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: In providing financial assistance under this section, the President shall ensure that the amount of financial assistance made available to an Indian tribal government is not less than $75,000,000.
Each State that receives assistance under this section shall distribute—

subparagraph.text: not less than 50 percent of the funds distributed under this subsection to the local government carrying out a project recommended under subsection (d)(1); and
any funds not distributed under (A) to activities described in subsections (b) and (e) of section 203.

paragraph.header: Additional eligibility for hazard mitigation assistance
paragraph.text: The receipt of funds for a project under this section may not be considered in determining eligibility for funding under section 404 for such project.

subparagraph.text: by striking In determining whether to provide technical and financial assistance to a State or local government under this section, the President shall provide financial assistance only in States that have and inserting The President may only provide financial assistance under this section to a State that has; and
by striking of such States and all that follows through in consultation with State and local governments. and inserting of such States.; and

paragraph.text: in subsection (h) by striking mitigation activities approved by the President and inserting mitigation activities under this section.

subsection.text: Section 404 of the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act (42 U.S.C. 5170c) is amended by adding at the end the following:

subsection.header: Additional eligibility for predisaster hazard mitigation assistance
subsection.text: The receipt of funds for a project under this section may not be considered in determining eligibility for funding under section 203 for such project.
